flow.descriptionCdata:
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.003c9f94-916c-43d0-a1a8-0710de378e51.description= 
Checks to see if a path points to a directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - the path to check
username - username to use when reading.
password - password to use when reading.

Responses\:
failure			- the operation failed. The path does not point to a directory.
success			- The operation succeeded.
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.3f20ce4b-dd9d-4ed6-958d-4ace7429fff0.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.5dba79a5-dfd4-4e58-a889-6137e5c70daf.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.752122c6-8774-45f7-9e6b-e902bc424731.description=
Executes an Expression (e.x value1 \=\= value2)

Input Parameters\:
value1 - the value to threshold with
value2 - the threshold to threshold against
operator - (\=\=, \!\=,  >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
okstring - string to push into returnResult if the threshold has not been passed
failedstring - string to push into the returnResult if the threshold has been passed

Responses\:
true - the expression is true
fales - the expression is false
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.890a3329-8960-43dd-af35-aa6d781fcedc.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.ad5351e4-51d8-44e2-8340-88a2d1805ea3.prompt=Should the operation check subfolders? WARNING this may be very slow 69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.bb7a16df-6da9-48f8-b39d-5b61c85f4352.description=
Gets a list of files and folders in a directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - The directory to check.
delimiter - A delimiter to put between files and folders in the directory.
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.

Returns\:
The children of the path.

Extra Results\:
count - The number of children.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The path probably could not be found, or was a file.
success - The operation succeeded.
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.c5b4197f-0d85-41ce-942b-60030e14cf0d.description=Iterates through a list of values.If the list changes while running, the updates will be appended to the list. Inputs\: list - The list to iterate through. separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list. Returns\: The current element of the list, if the response is has more Responses\: has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned. has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list. failure - failed to process the list. Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously. WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.. 69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.description=
Goes through a Windows directory and returns the name of the largest file.

Inputs\:
Source - The source directory.
user - The username to run as.
password - Password for user.
recursive - Whether to recurse through sub-directories.

Responses\:
success - Operation completed.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
The name of the largest file.

Extra Results\:
size - The size of the largest file.
69a282f7-a37d-46b2-8245-7da977bf2e77.e81a7161-7415-4537-a890-f0ef04df3879.description=
Compares a files size to a given threshold.

Input Parameters\:
source - The file to read
threshold - The threshold to compare the file size to (in bytes).
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The file probably could not be found.
greater than	- The file's size is larger than the threshold.
less than - The file's size is smaller than the threshold.
equal to - The file's size is the same as the threshold.

Extra Results\:
size - The file's size in bytes.
flow.name: Get Largest File (1)
